type-conversion-intro_key2: **Note: Remember to run all the `code` examples and see them. Only by trying them will you be able to learn.**
type-conversion-intro_key4: In the previous sections, we understood that there are different types of data types in `Python`. Some of the types we have read about are:
type-conversion-intro_key8: Some examples are given below. Read them carefully.
type-conversion-intro_key9: We can convert our data from one `type` to another `data type`  in `python`. This will come in very handy in the future because we will often have data in one type and we will have to convert to another type. In `Python` we can do these `type `conversions``  -
type-conversion-intro_key17: Now let us see how to convert to `Integer`. Type cast `12` to `Python` `Integer` and store 12
type-conversion-intro_key18: `Python` does not know how to extract `integers` from `12houses`
type-conversion-intro_key19: `Python` tries to convert `String` to `Integer` but throws an `error` if it is even a bit confusing. e.g. `Python` cannot convert 12.2, and 12houses to `integer` but can do the same for 12.
type-conversion-intro_key20: `Python` does not know how to extract `integers` from `12`
type-conversion-intro_key22: Converts any '`float`' to `Python` `integer` by removing its decimal part.
type-conversion-intro_key23: Now we will learn to cast type in `FLOAT`. This is similar to type casting to '`Integer`'. See it yourself.
type-conversion-intro_key24: `Python` does not know how to extract `float` from `12houses`
type-conversion-intro_key26: `Python` simply adds the decimal point when we convert `INTEGER` to `FLOAT`
type-conversion-intro_key27: Look carefully here that `Python` adds `.0` to the last. Try converting a `float` `12.2` to `Integer` in `Python`. Try and Understand what is happening.
